title: Authors and Citation
text: Sadr , Caravagna G (2023). basilica: basilica. https://github.com/caravagnalab/basilica, https://caravagnalab.github.io/basilica/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {basilica: basilica},   author = {Azad Sadr and Giulio Caravagna},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/caravagnalab/basilica, https://caravagnalab.github.io/basilica/}, }

title: basilica
text: Basilica hierarchical Bayesian model fit single-nucleotide substitution signatures multiple groups patients, leveraging pre-existing catalogue known signatures COSMIC. Basilica searches known signatures input catalogue well new signatures outside catalogue, accounting hidden structure input data (e.g., distinct tumour types). model uses non-negative matrix factorisation variational inference implemented pybasilica Python package.

title: basilica
text: use basilica, please cite: ……

title: basilica
text: can install released version basilica GitHub :

title: basilica
text: Azad Sadr, Giulio Caravagna. Cancer Data Science (CDS) Laboratory, University Trieste, Italy.

title: basilica: basilica — basilica-package
text: packages provides basilica (Bayesian signature learning including catalogue) algorithm detect single-nucleotide substituion signatures cancer. main feature basilica provide full Bayesian hierarchical formulation based non-negative matrix factorisation, leveraging semi-supervised trainig set (.e., catalogue). tool specifically developed detect de novo mutational signatures different pre-defined reference catalogue.

title: basilica: basilica — basilica-package
text: Maintainer: Azad Sadr azad.sadr.h@gmail.com Authors: Giulio Caravagna gcaravagn@gmail.com

title: Configure the reticulate environment — configure_environment
text: Function configure Python dependencies R. Python environment available, function check version conda miniconda, otherwise install miniconda, install Python package pybasilica.

title: fit basilica model. — fit
text: fit model infer underlying signatures contributions mutational catalogue counts.

title: fit basilica model. — fit
code: fit(   x,   k,   py = NULL,   reference_catalogue = COSMIC_filtered,   input_catalogue = COSMIC_filtered["SBS1", ],   filtered_cat = FALSE,   cohort = "MyCohort",   lr = 0.01,   steps = 500,   max_iterations = 20,   blacklist = NULL,   phi = 0.05,   delta = 0.9,   filt_pi = 0.1,   groups = NULL,   lambda_rate = NULL,   sigma = FALSE,   CUDA = FALSE,   compile = FALSE,   enforce_sparsity = FALSE,   store_parameters = FALSE,   regularizer = "cosine",   reg_weight = 1,   reg_bic = FALSE,   cosine_by_subs = FALSE )

title: fit basilica model. — fit
text: x input mutational counts data (data.frame; rows samples columns 96 mutational categories) k vector possible number de novo signatures infer reference_catalogue catalog reference signatures basilica use compare input de novo signatures (COSMIC catalogue default) input_catalogue input signature profiles, NULL default cohort add lr stochastic variational inference learning rate steps number gradient steps max_iterations add blacklist add phi threshold discard signature based value exposure matrix delta threshold consider inferred signature COSMIC signature filt_pi threshold COSMIC signature weight included basis denovo signatures groups vector discrete labels one entry per sample, defines groups considered basilica lambda_rate add sigma add enforce_sparsity use Laplace prior exposure weights (bayesian LASSO)

title: fit basilica model. — fit
text: inferred exposure matrix, inferred signatures reference catalogue inferred de novo (reference catalogue) signatures
